medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in usual health until approximately 3 months prior, when mild swelling of the left leg developed. Three days before presentation, pain in the back, both flanks, and left leg developed with increased leg swelling. No trauma, fevers, night sweats, or weight loss reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Arthritis, asthma, hypercholesterolemia, hypertension, non–insulin-dependent type 2 diabetes mellitus, positive tuberculin skin test in the remote past, partial colectomy for resection of stage T1 colon cancer 7 years ago, lumpectomy of left breast, laparoscopic cholecystectomy, total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy for benign disease.
medical_history.family_history: Father had Alzheimer’s disease and diabetes mellitus; mother had heart disease and breast cancer; sister had breast cancer; brother had hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, and coronary artery disease; two brothers had diabetes mellitus and died before age 70.
medical_history.social_history: Widowed, of African-American ancestry. Did not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
